snippet: A prisoner in Arkansas, contending that his Muslim faith requires him to wear a beard, is challenging a ban on long facial hair that state prison officials say is needed to promote hygiene and deter the concealment of contraband.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to decide whether prison officials in Arkansas may prohibit inmates from growing beards in accordance with their religious beliefs; policy was challenged by Gregory H Holt, who is serving life sentence for burglary and domestic batter and says his Muslim faith requires him to grow beard.
lead_paragraph: A prisoner in Arkansas, contending that his Muslim faith requires him to wear a beard, is challenging a ban on long facial hair that state prison officials say is needed to promote hygiene and deter the concealment of contraband.

headline.main: Supreme Court Agrees to Weigh an Inmate’s Right to Grow a Beard for Religious Reasons
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Agrees to Weigh an Inmate’s Right to Grow a Beard for Religious Reasons
